body: fixes #482 --- This change isâ€‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/483)

comment_regular_data.body: This seems to fail on windows, need to look into how it could be fixed...
@cebe seems to work fine on travis. Was appveyor ever fixed? And if yes, did you rebase on that fix?
appveyor fails with the error message I added so it is definitively related.  https://ci.appveyor.com/project/iphydf/c-toxcore/build/1.0.138#L254
Check the checkbox that allows collaborators to push to the PR branch. Also, rebase (appveyor should work now).

The AppVeyor can't build libtoxav, as cmake doesn't know where to look for opus and vpx libraries when there is no pkg-config, as I have mentioned in https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/477#issuecomment-283906298. You can just add `-DBUILD_TOXAV=OFF` to the AppVeyor cmake command and let someone else to fix this in a separate PR.
Btw, autotools would skip building of toxav if opus or vpx are not found. Are we fine with changing this behavior only in cmake but keeping it in autotools?

I'm not very happy with this PR. I think the change has to be done in https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/blob/master/cmake/Dependencies.cmake instead of CMakeLists.txt. Something along the lines of

```cmake
option(BUILD_TOXAV "Whether to build the tox AV library" ON)

if(BUILD_TOXAV)
  pkg_use_module(OPUS                 opus         REQUIRED)
  pkg_use_module(VPX                  vpx          REQUIRED)
endif()
```

`pkg_use_module()` would need to pass the `REQUIRED` into `pkg_search_module()` [[1]](https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/blob/ce0bf232d1b2c01df056df9a030e10ba5252832f/cmake/ModulePackage.cmake#L39), [[2]](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/module/FindPkgConfig.html).
Also, with the PR as it is now, if you specify `-DBUILD_TOXAV=OFF`, libtoxav would still be built if you have opus and vpx, which is probably not what you want when you set `BUILD_TOXAV` to `OFF`.
Oh, I see, the `BUILD_TOXAV` was already in CMakeLists.txt before this PR. Was looking only at the diff. So my last comment is incorrect, it won't build libtoxav if you set `BUILD_TOXAV` to `OFF`.

I guess it's okay as it is. --- Reviewed 1 of 1 files at r1. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, all discussions resolved, some commit checks failed. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/483#-:-KeWxomD8qvpx64Wy7bd:b-trh12r)*

> You can just add -DBUILD_TOXAV=OFF to the AppVeyor cmake command and let someone else to fix this in a separate PR.

done.

> Btw, autotools would skip building of toxav if opus or vpx are not found. Are we fine with changing this behavior only in cmake but keeping it in autotools?

I do not know enough about autotools to change it. If you want autotools to behave the same, someone else has to do that.

This is NOT what I wanted for uTox.

While better, this was supposed to allow the user to override the cmake options. E.g. on the osx-crosscompile env we're using to build uTox-OSX on linux, tokcore can't find the vpx or opus libs, but they're available.

Is the solution to add `-DFORCE_BUILD_TOXAV`, or to drop `SEND_ERROR`?

where are they, if they are available? This fix makes it clear where the error is, so the build systems does not assume you did not want Opus or VPX if it can not find them.

If there is a problem with finding the libs, the depencency finder of cmake should be fixed to support that case.

commit.message:
make BUILD_TOXAV and option and fail if dependencies are missing

fixes #482
